MissionRules.Name: Sweep and Clear
MissionRules.Rule: In this mission, if you control an objective marker at the end of your Command phase, it remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, unless your opponent controls it at the end of any subsequent phase.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Surgical Assault
ObjectiveList: Score 5 victory points if you control the objective marker in your opponent's deployment zone at the end of your turn.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Survey
ObjectiveList: Score 5 victory points if you control both of the objective markers that are not in either player's deployment zone at the end of your Command phase. This secondary objective cannot be scored in the first battle round.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Encircle
ObjectiveList: Score 3 victory points if you have at least one unit from your army (excluding aircraft) wholly within 6" of your battlefield edge at the end of your turn and at least one unit from your army (excluding aircraft) wholly within 6" of your opponent's battlefield edge at the end of your turn (score 5 victory points instead if one of these units is also wholly within your opponent's deployment zone)

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Lines of Demarcation
ObjectiveList: At the end of your turn, you score 4 victory points if you control both objective markers labelled A, or 2 victory points if control both objective markers labelled B.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

MissionRules.Name: Crossfire
MissionRules.Rule:
When resolving attacks against units that are within 9" of the centre of the battlefield, those attacks ignore the benefits of cover provided you can satisfy at least one of the following conditions:
- You control both objective markers labelled A and the attacking model's unit is in range of an objective marker labelled A.
- You control both objective markers labelled B and the attacking model's unit is in range of an objective marker labelled B.

SecondaryObjective.Name: Outflank
ObjectiveList: At the end of your command phase, you score 3 victory points if you control both of the objective markers labelled A. Score 5 victory points instead if, at the end of your command phase, you control both of the objective markers labelled A and there is at least on enemy unit within 9" of the centre of the battlefield. This secondary objective cannot be scored in the first battle round.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Centre Ground
ObjectiveList: Each time a unit from your army succesfully completes the following action, you score 3 victory points if you control one of the objective markers labelled A, or 5 victory points if you currently control both objective markers labelled A.

Action.Name: Centre Ground
Action.Action: One unit from your army can start to perform this action at the end of your Movement phase if it is within range of an objective marker labelled A and no enemy units (excluding AIRCRAFT) are within range of that objective marker. The action is completed at the end of your next Command phase so long as the unit performing it is still within range of the same objective marker.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

MissionRules.Name: Quick March
MissionRules.Rule: Any Advance rolls of less than 3 made in the first battle round instead count as 3.

SecondaryObjective.Name: Forward Push
ObjectiveList: If you select this object then units in your army can perform the following action:

Action.Name: Forward Push
Action.Action: One unit in your army can start to perform this action at the start of your Movement Phase if it is within range of an objective marker that you control. The action is completed at the end of your turn and you score a number of victory points depending on which objective marker this action was performed on:

PrimaryObjective.Name: Domination
ObjectiveList: They control two or more objective markers
They control three or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

SecondaryObjective.Name: Ransack
ObjectiveList: Score a number of victory points at the end of your Command phase if you control one or more of the objective markers that are within your opponent's territory, as shown on the table below:

Headings: Number of objective markers in opponent's territory you control

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls

MissionRules.Name: Supply Lines
MissionRules.Rule: In this mission, a player only receives the Battle-forged CP bonus at the start of their Command phase if they control the objective in their deployment zone.

SecondaryObjective.Name: Test Their Line
ObjectiveList: Score 3 victory points at the end of your turn if two or more units from your army (excluding AIRCRAFT) are wholly within your opponent's deployment zone and at least two different battlefield edges have at least one those units wholly within 6" of them (if one of those edges is yout opponent's battlefield edge, score 5 victory points instead). For the purposes of this objective, a unit can only count as being wholly within 6" of one battlefield edge at a time - if a unit is with 6" of two battlefield edges because it is in the corner of the battlefiled, you can select which edge it counts as being wholly within 6" of at the end of your turn.

PrimaryObjective.Name: Take and Hold
ObjectiveList: They control one or more objective markers
They control two or more objective markers
They control more objective markers than their opponent controls
